content.webTitle: TV tonight: Piers Morgan in a sinister meeting with an unrepentant killer

fields.headline: TV tonight: Piers Morgan in a sinister meeting with an unrepentant killer
fields.bodyText: Psychopath With Piers Morgan 9pm, ITV If you thought that Morgan’s recent Confessions of a Serial Killer encounter with Bernard Giles was sinister, wait until you meet tonight’s subject. In 2007, at the age of 13, Paris Bennett stabbed his four-year-old sister Ella to death. Now, he languishes in a Texas state prison, where he is considered so dangerous that this interview is conducted through toughened glass. His mother, Charity, watches in a separate room as he describes the killing as a deliberate act of revenge against her. Mike Bradley Who Should Get to Stay in the UK? 9pm, BBC Two A last tour around the absurd cruelty of our immigration system. This week, spouses: families who live and work here, boosting our economy, but one of them is foreign, so here come capricious rules. Onyi, for example, has quit her steady job and started her own business. Big mistake. Jack Seale Catch-22 9pm, Channel 4 As you suspected it might, this adaptation of the Joseph Heller classic – about second world war bombardier John Yossarian who is shocked to discover that the real enemy is his own side – is starting to settle in nicely. Following some well-choreographed comedy, this week Yossarian catches a break. MB Arabia With Levison Wood 9pm, Discovery The first in a five-part series sees the professional TV traveller Levison Wood embark on a 5,000-mile circumnavigation of the Arabian Peninsula. In a compelling opener, he witnesses the final assault against Isis from the frontline before experiencing a poetic encounter with the marsh Arabs of Iraq. MB Liam v Noel: Brothers at War 10pm, Channel 5 The fraught story of the Gallaghers and their supersonic rise might seem overly familiar, but this stylishly assembled film – marking 10 years since the Oasis gig in Paris where Noel finally walked – is a lively retelling, with veteran raconteurs Alan McGee, Terry Christian, Shaun Ryder and many more. Graeme Virtue The Other Two 10pm, E4 Penned by alumni from Saturday Night Live, this comedy about two failing performers whose brother is a Bieber-like singer has been one of the most unexpectedly joyous shows of the year. Episode seven sees Cary suck up to the local “Instagays” to bag an audition for American Crime Story, with abject results. Hannah J Davies Film choice Cape Fear (Martin Scorsese, 1991), 11.40pm, ITV4 Martin Scorsese’s remake of the 1962 thriller stars a scenery-chomping Robert De Niro as Max Cady, a rapist ex-con seeking vengeance against Nick Nolte’s Sam Bowden, the lawyer who put him away. Sam’s wife and daughter (Jessica Lange, Juliette Lewis) are the targets in a brutal, heated tale. Paula Howlett Sport choice PGA Tour Golf: Rocket Mortgage Classic 1pm, Sky Sports Golf. Day one action from Detroit Golf Club. Rugby League: Hull Kingston Rovers v Hull FC 7pm, Sky Sports Main Event. A Super League derby. Women’s World Cup Football 7.30pm, BBC Four. Le Havre, Normandy hosts the first quarter final.
